randgeo
  • Reference

  • News

Introduction to the randgeo package

Scott Chamberlain and Noam Ross

2017-02-23

randgeo is a no dependency R package for generating random lat/long positions, or random WKT or GeoJSON points or polygons.

The benefit of no dependencies is that it can easily be used in other packages without any pain. e.g., you may want to show examples in your package but you don’t want a heavy dependency just for examples.

This package is adapted from Javascript’s https://github.com/tmcw/geojson-random but with modifications.

Install

Stable randgeo version from CRAN

install.packages("randgeo")

Or, the development version from Github

devtools::install_github("ropensci/randgeo")
library("randgeo")

random position

rg_position()
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 92.66656 49.03692

Many positions

rg_position(10)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] -110.26876   21.81701
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] -130.48813  -44.07551
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] -5.320085  3.411949
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] 104.77633  21.96459
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1] -68.84478  18.04051
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> [1] 118.23959  26.87265
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> [1] -24.899009   9.567203
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> [1] -131.64761  -21.88117
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> [1] -118.05188  -57.88544
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> [1] 40.94769 21.63800

Random position within a bounding box

rg_position(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 58.09733 58.89973

Well-known text

random points

A single point

wkt_point()
#> [1] "POINT (-134.8927922 -7.5339932)"

Many points

wkt_point(count = 10)
#>  [1] "POINT (-134.0492017 -14.7851539)" "POINT (-152.8833766 25.4102895)" 
#>  [3] "POINT (-68.1831255 44.9544878)"   "POINT (107.9173848 40.9961141)"  
#>  [5] "POINT (102.8461724 3.4357071)"    "POINT (-24.1352175 -8.5727876)"  
#>  [7] "POINT (82.7891803 -52.0338455)"   "POINT (-100.6897071 24.6331713)" 
#>  [9] "POINT (112.6435497 65.8945511)"   "POINT (1.8977993 31.1103660)"

Within a bounding box

wkt_point(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> [1] "POINT (55.8914242 59.6709926)"

The fmt parameter controls how many decimal points

wkt_point()
#> [1] "POINT (-96.2204388 -47.2933627)"
wkt_point(fmt = 10)
#> [1] "POINT (-140.1257725898 -37.0838795676)"

random polygons

wkt_polygon()
#> [1] "POLYGON ((57.5560427 -15.5439421, 63.3594135 -11.9249699, 60.4540597 -15.0511605, 59.5509381 -16.3950471, 63.5178473 -18.4134675, 54.1817454 -18.4465819, 52.8181444 -18.1328197, 50.4014264 -17.0447201, 51.2295973 -16.9749241, 55.6478482 -12.9974332, 57.5560427 -15.5439421))"

Adjust number of vertices (Default: 10)

wkt_polygon(num_vertices = 4)
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-127.1999896 -56.0631796, -128.7916828 -59.9313339, -134.4344371 -67.5825298, -141.9261274 -61.0361188, -127.1999896 -56.0631796))"

Adjust maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon (Default: 10)

wkt_polygon(max_radial_length = 5)
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-114.3640603 37.0036216, -115.5243047 36.8344581, -113.9557900 35.3013283, -115.7034913 33.9104198, -116.1019851 33.8478191, -116.6032842 37.1124477, -121.7157123 34.3944763, -119.8910405 35.4486274, -116.6849290 37.0968942, -117.6433612 37.7288366, -114.3640603 37.0036216))"

Within a bounding box

wkt_polygon(bbox = c(-130, 50, -120, 60))
#> [1] "POLYGON ((-112.8113685 53.2525492, -119.8921676 47.4379634, -125.1981831 48.9680310, -127.2600774 52.6183992, -127.3233343 52.3000992, -137.5070918 49.7689431, -128.2893396 53.1629207, -127.5423907 53.1464333, -127.3967324 53.0018884, -127.7933110 56.5208527, -112.8113685 53.2525492))"

GeoJSON

random points

A single point

geo_point()
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1] -124.6450  -62.8048
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> list()

Many points

geo_point(count = 10)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
...

Within a bounding box

geo_point(bbox = c(50, 50, 60, 60))
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Point"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> [1] 57.08846 50.57915
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> list()

random polygons

geo_polygon()
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#> [1]  8.253229 44.234616
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1]  7.624981 42.677864
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[3]]
#> [1]  6.936492 39.457413
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[4]]
#> [1] 11.13904 38.84108
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[5]]
#> [1] 13.04259 35.87771
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[6]]
#> [1] 16.26929 35.33338
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[7]]
#> [1] 10.10377 35.67495
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[8]]
#> [1]  3.335763 34.513197
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[9]]
#> [1]  0.8080101 35.2858958
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[10]]
#> [1] -2.526393 41.824582
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[11]]
#> [1]  8.253229 44.234616
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> list()

Adjust number of vertices (Default: 10)

geo_polygon(num_vertices = 4)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type
#> [1] "Feature"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$type
#> [1] "Polygon"
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#> [1] -179.22406   29.23005
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] -176.00974   20.96255
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[3]]
#> [1] 176.05706  25.67676
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[4]]
#> [1] -179.95905   20.23693
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[5]]
#> [1] -179.22406   29.23005
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$properties
#> list()

Adjust maximum number of decimal degrees latitude or longitude that a vertex can reach out of the center of the Polygon (Default: 10)

geo_polygon(max_radial_length = 5)
#> $type
#> [1] "FeatureCollection"
#> 
#> $features
#> $features[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$type

#> [1] "Polygon"
#>

#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]]
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#> [1] 140.14924  22.28984
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] 142.65358  24.38424
#>

#> [1] 140.16593  19.07201
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[5]]
#> [1] 137.91470  20.51303
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[6]]
#> [1] 138.65525  21.33297
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[7]]
#> [1] 139.96696  21.99469
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[8]]
#> [1] 137.07325  21.61696
#> 
#> $features[[1]]$geometry$coordinates[[1]][[9]]

#>

geo_polygon(bbox = c(-130, 50, -120, 60))
